protocol_name: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
protocol_name_html: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
description:
Third generation sequencing aims to sequence long DNA molecules. High-quality and high-molecular-weight DNA is needed to fully benefit from the potential of third-generation sequencers. The cost of sequencing continues to decrease but DNA extraction kits remain expensive. Here is a fast and cheap protocol to extract genomic DNA from Gram-negative bacteria. The original protocol has been fine-tuned for Xanthomonas ssp., which is a tricky bacteria as it secrets a lot of extracellular polysaccharides. We found that bacterial culture can impact the purity of the final DNA solution. In addition, the lysis temperature and mixing by pipetting are critical to get an efficient homogenization as the sample becomes very viscous at some steps (see 'Assessment of various parameters.xlsx' attached below).

High yield Nanopore runs can be achieved with these gDNA samples (see 'Nanopore sequencing report.pdf' attached below).

 

Acknowledgements:

I would like to thank Harihar Jaishree Subrahmaniam, Rekha Gopalan Nair, and BenjaminSchwessinger for their feedbacks and their corrections on this protocol.
before_start:
Prepare the following solutions:

  • Lysis buffer:
Lysis buffer Stock concentration Final concentration Volume for 10ml 
H2O - - 5.25 ml
NaCl 2.5 M 0.5M 2ml
Tris HCl pH=8 1 M 100mM 1ml
EDTA pH=8 0 0.5 M 50mM 1ml
SDS 20% 1.5%

750µl
Total - -

10ml

 

 

  • Beads solution:

Beads solution is the same as in this protocol:

 

Ramawatar, Benjamin Schwessinger (1523238626). DNA size selection (>3-4kb) and purification of DNA using an improved homemade SPRI beads solution.. protocols.io
dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.n7hdhj6
 
Beads solution Stock concentration Final concentration Volume for 10ml 
Tris HCl pH=8 1 M 10 mM  100 μl
EDTA pH=8 0 0.5 M  1 mM  20 μl
NaCl 5 M  1.6 M 3.2 ml
PEG 8000  50% (w/v)  11% 2.2 ml
 Tween 20  10 % (v/v) 0.20% 200 µl
Washed Sera-Mag beads (v/v) 100%  0.40%  40 μl
H2O  - - up to 10ml
Total   - -

 10 ml
 
1- Frist combine only Water, Tris-HCl, EDTA and NaCl in a 50 mL tube. 
 
2- Vortex Sera-Mag SpeedBeads® Carboxyl Magnetic Beads (GE Healthcare)  very well and pipette 40 μl into a 1.5 ml tube, put it on the magnetic rack and wait until the solution has cleared up and all beads have bound to the back of the tube
 
3- Wash beads by removing supernatant and adding 1 ml Milli-Q water
 
4- Take tube of the magnet, mix well, spin down in a microcentrifuge and put back on the magnet
 
5- Wait for beads to assemble at the back of the tube 
 
6- Pipette off and discard supernatant
 
7- Repeat washing (steps 3 - 6) 3 more times

 

8- After pipetting of the supernatant the last time take off tube from the magnet and add 40 μl of the previous (step 1) prepared stock solution, mix well, spin down and pipette everything into the remaining stock solution in the 50 mL tube and mix

 

9- Now the 2.2 ml 50% PEG can be added to the stock solution, which after vortexing very well is ready for use. 

 

Be careful to actually pipette 2.2 ml as solution is very viscous, but the final concentration of PEG is crucial for the clean up to work properly.

 

10-

  • Potassium acetate 5M:
Dissolve 4.9 g of potassium acetate in 10 ml of molecular grade water.

materials.reagent_name: GE Healthcare Sera-Mag SpeedBeads™ Carboxyl Magnetic Beads, hydrophobic

protocol_affiliation: French National Institute for Agricultural Research
manuscript_citation:
Modified from the protocol of Baptiste Mayjonade, Jérome Gouzy, Cécile Donnadieu, Nicolas Pouilly, William Marande, Caroline Callot, Nicolas Langlade and Stéphane Munos, High molecular weight gDNA extraction, Bio Techniques, Vol. 61, No. 4, October 2016, pp. 203-205. BioTechniques 61:203-205 (October 2016) doi 10.2144/000114460

https://www.future-science.com/doi/10.2144/000114460

 

The beads solution used here comes from this protocol: Ramawatar, Benjamin Schwessinger (1523238626). DNA size selection (>3-4kb) and purification of DNA using an improved homemade SPRI beads solution.. protocols.io
dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.n7hdhj6

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

authors_list.name: Baptiste Mayjonade
authors_list.affiliation: French National Institute for Agricultural Research

guidelines:
Modified from the protocol of Baptiste Mayjonade, Jérome Gouzy, Cécile Donnadieu, Nicolas Pouilly, William Marande, Caroline Callot, Nicolas Langlade and Stéphane Munos, High molecular weight gDNA extraction, Bio Techniques, Vol. 61, No. 4, October 2016, pp. 203-205.

https://www.future-science.com/doi/10.2144/000114460

 

The beads solution used in this protocol is the same as in this protocol:

Ramawatar, Benjamin Schwessinger (1523238626). DNA size selection (>3-4kb) and purification of DNA using an improved homemade SPRI beads solution.. protocols.io
dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.n7hdhj6

 

When citing please make sure to mention the original Mayjonade et al. protocol as described above and the protocol for the beads solution.

 

pH makes a huge difference in the solubility of DNA and beads. If not set properly, beads tend to clump at DNA elution step that could lose as much 60-70 percent of the DNA. So make sure that your elution buffer (e.g. 10 mM Tris or 0.1 x TE) has a pH of 8.

 

Store beads solution at 4°C. Allow beads solution to come to room temperature before use (30 minutes).

 

Mix the beads solution well by vortexing before use.

 

Always use freshly prepared  70 % Ethanol
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Inoculate a single bacterial colony into 10 mL of 10% TSB (i.e. 3g/l) (Fisherbrand™, Tryptone Caseine Soy Broth Product Code.12186620). Cultivate the bacteria for 48h at 28°C under constant agitation (120 rpm).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Inoculate a single bacterial colony into 10 mL of 10% TSB (i.e. 3g/l) (Fisherbrand™, Tryptone Caseine Soy Broth Product Code.12186620). Cultivate the bacteria for 48h at 28°C under constant agitation (120 rpm).

Note: Culture medium and growth time can impact the purity of the gDNA (especially for bacterial species secreting extracellular polysaccharides like Xanthomonas ssp.).

See "Assessment of various parameters.xlsx" file attached in the abstract section.

components.data: Heat the lysis buffer for >30 minutes at 65°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Heat the lysis buffer for >30 minutes at 65°C

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 2 of Gram negative bacteria genomic DNA extraction for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.protocol_name: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)

source_data.annotation: The composition of the lysis buffer is given in the Guidelines.
source_data.thread_text: The composition of the lysis buffer is given in the Guidelines.
source_data.body: The composition of the lysis buffer is given in the Guidelines.

components.data: Centrifuge 1.8 mL of bacterial culture in a 2 mL tube at 10 000g for 5 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge 1.8 mL of bacterial culture in a 2 mL tube at 10 000g for 5 minutes

components.data: Discard the supernatant by pouring off the liquid removing all growth media.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant by pouring off the liquid removing all growth media.

components.data: Set a P1000 pipette on 900 µl and resuspend the bacterial pellet into 900 µl of lysis buffer (preheated at 65°C) by pipetting up and down vigorously 10 times (with an uncut P1000 tip). This step is critical for the yield and it is very important to pipette the complete liquid up and down vigorously so all the liquid enters the pipette tip during mixing. Apparition of foam is good.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set a P1000 pipette on 900 µl and resuspend the bacterial pellet into 900 µl of lysis buffer (preheated at 65°C) by pipetting up and down vigorously 10 times (with an uncut P1000 tip). This step is critical for the yield and it is very important to pipette the complete liquid up and down vigorously so all the liquid enters the pipette tip during mixing. Apparition of foam is good.

components.data: Incubate at 65°C in a dry bath for 20 minutes (invert the tube vigorously 10 times after 10 minutes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 65°C in a dry bath for 20 minutes (invert the tube vigorously 10 times after 10 minutes).

See "Assessment of various parameters.xlsx" file attached in the abstract section.

source_data.description: Spin down the tube for 1 second

components.data: Add 4 µl of RNAse A 100 mg/ml (QIAGEN, Cat No./ID: 19101)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 4 µl of RNAse A 100 mg/ml (QIAGEN, Cat No./ID: 19101)

components.data: Mix by inverting the tube 10 times and spin down for 1 second
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix by inverting the tube 10 times and spin down for 1 second
Incubate at room temperature (18-23°C) for 10 minutes

components.data: Add 300 µl of 5M Potassium Acetate solution (or 1/3 of the lysis buffer volume)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 300 µl of 5M Potassium Acetate solution (or 1/3 of the lysis buffer volume)

components.data: Mix by pipetting vigorously and completely 10 times with a P1000 set on 1000 µl and using a P1000 tip cut at 0.5 cm from the tip end (to minimize DNA shearing).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix by pipetting vigorously and completely 10 times with a P1000 set on 1000 µl and using a P1000 tip cut at 0.5 cm from the tip end (to minimize DNA shearing).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 12 of Gram negative bacteria genomic DNA extraction for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.protocol_name: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.protocol_name_html: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.annotation: This step is very important to precipitate contaminants and therefore will impact the purity of the final gDNA solution. The solution gets very viscous after Potassium Acetate addition and mixing by inverting the tube is not efficient enough.
source_data.thread_text: This step is very important to precipitate contaminants and therefore will impact the purity of the final gDNA solution. The solution gets very viscous after Potassium Acetate addition and mixing by inverting the tube is not efficient enough.
source_data.body: This step is very important to precipitate contaminants and therefore will impact the purity of the final gDNA solution. The solution gets very viscous after Potassium Acetate addition and mixing by inverting the tube is not efficient enough.

components.data: Centrifuge the tube at 10 000g for 10 minutes at room temperature
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tube at 10 000g for 10 minutes at room temperature

components.data: Transfer the upper phase into a new 2 mL tube without disturbing the pellet (typically 800µl)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the upper phase into a new 2 mL tube without disturbing the pellet (typically 800µl)

components.data: Add the same volume (800 µl) of beads solution previously prepared (make sure beads are at room temperature for >30 minutes and well homogenized via vortexing for approximately 30 seconds)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the same volume (800 µl) of beads solution previously prepared (make sure beads are at room temperature for >30 minutes and well homogenized via vortexing for approximately 30 seconds)

components.data: Incubate on a rotator at 10 rpm for at least 15 minutes at room temperature
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate on a rotator at 10 rpm for at least 15 minutes at room temperature
Spin down the tube for 1 second

components.data: Place the tube on a magnetic rack and wait for 3 minutes (until beads are stuck to the wall of the tube and solution becomes clear)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube on a magnetic rack and wait for 3 minutes (until beads are stuck to the wall of the tube and solution becomes clear)

components.data: Discard the supernatant by pipetting without taking out any beads
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant by pipetting without taking out any beads
Add 1 mL of fresh 70% ethanol

components.data: Close the tube and resuspend the beads by inverting the tube 20 times. It is very important that the beads are resuspended in ethanol to ensure an efficient wash. If beads are still stuck to the wall of the tube you can flick the tube to resuspend them
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Close the tube and resuspend the beads by inverting the tube 20 times. It is very important that the beads are resuspended in ethanol to ensure an efficient wash. If beads are still stuck to the wall of the tube you can flick the tube to resuspend them
Spin down the tube for 1 second

components.data: Put the tube back on the magnetic rack. At this step, beads move immediately to the wall of the tube
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put the tube back on the magnetic rack. At this step, beads move immediately to the wall of the tube

components.data: Remove the supernatant without disturbing the beads
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the supernatant without disturbing the beads

components.data: Repeat the steps 20 to 24 to wash the beads one more time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat the steps 20 to 24 to wash the beads one more time.

components.data: Spin down the tube to bring all the droplets to the bottom of the tube
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down the tube to bring all the droplets to the bottom of the tube

components.data: Put the tube back on the magnetic rack and remove all the ethanol with a P200 or P10 pipette. Let beads air drying for a maximum of 30 seconds or else it can affect the DNA integrity and reduce the yield.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put the tube back on the magnetic rack and remove all the ethanol with a P200 or P10 pipette. Let beads air drying for a maximum of 30 seconds or else it can affect the DNA integrity and reduce the yield.

components.data: Add 100 µl of Elution Buffer (QIAGEN, Cat No./ID: 19086)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 µl of Elution Buffer (QIAGEN, Cat No./ID: 19086)

source_data.protocol_name_html: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.annotation: The composition of Buffer EB is: 10 mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5.
source_data.thread_text: The composition of Buffer EB is: 10 mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5.
source_data.body: The composition of Buffer EB is: 10 mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.5.

components.data: Resuspend the beads by flicking the tube (make sure they are not aggregated anymore).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the beads by flicking the tube (make sure they are not aggregated anymore).
Incubate the tube for 15 minutes at 37°C.
Flick the tube again
Spin down the tube for 1 second

components.data: Place the tube on a magnetic rack and wait for the solution to become clear. This can be time consuming when the gDNA solution is very concentrated (>200ng/µl). You can add additional elution buffer or just wait for hours!
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube on a magnetic rack and wait for the solution to become clear. This can be time consuming when the gDNA solution is very concentrated (>200ng/µl). You can add additional elution buffer or just wait for hours!

components.data: Transfer the solution into a new tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the solution into a new tube.

components.data:
Check the DNA purity by measuring the gDNA concentration with a Qubit and a Nanodrop. Qubit/Nanodrop ratio should be around 1.2 (Qubit concentration is higher than Nanodrop concentration for Xanthomonas gDNA).

 

Typically gDNA concentration is between 50 and 200 ng/µl.

 

A260/A280 ratio should be 1.8 – 2. If this ratio is >2 it is likely that the sample is contaminated by RNA. RNA contamination also leads to a shift between Qubit and Nanodrop concentrations. To get rid of RNA, you can follow the additional purification n°1 below (Additional purification 1: RNA removal starting from step 36).

 

A260/A230 ratio should be 2 – 2.2. If this ratio is <2 you can follow the purification below (Additional purification 2: A260/A230 improvement starting from step 43)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Check the DNA purity by measuring the gDNA concentration with a Qubit and a Nanodrop. Qubit/Nanodrop ratio should be around 1.2 (Qubit concentration is higher than Nanodrop concentration for Xanthomonas gDNA).

 

Typically gDNA concentration is between 50 and 200 ng/µl.

 

A260/A280 ratio should be 1.8 – 2. If this ratio is >2 it is likely that the sample is contaminated by RNA. RNA contamination also leads to a shift between Qubit and Nanodrop concentrations. To get rid of RNA, you can follow the additional purification n°1 below (Additional purification 1: RNA removal starting from step 36).

 

A260/A230 ratio should be 2 – 2.2. If this ratio is <2 you can follow the purification below (Additional purification 2: A260/A230 improvement starting from step 43)

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 35 of Gram negative bacteria genomic DNA extraction for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.protocol_name: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.protocol_name_html: High Molecular Weight genomic DNA extraction from Gram-negative bacteria for long reads sequencing (Xanthomonas ssp.)
source_data.annotation: Qubit measurement is the most accurate as it is specific for double stranded DNA. Overestimation of the DNA concentration by the Nanodrop means that there are other compounds which absorb at 260 nm and therefore the gDNA is not pure.
source_data.thread_text: Qubit measurement is the most accurate as it is specific for double stranded DNA. Overestimation of the DNA concentration by the Nanodrop means that there are other compounds which absorb at 260 nm and therefore the gDNA is not pure.
source_data.body: Qubit measurement is the most accurate as it is specific for double stranded DNA. Overestimation of the DNA concentration by the Nanodrop means that there are other compounds which absorb at 260 nm and therefore the gDNA is not pure.

components.data: Add 1µl of RNase A 100 mg/ml for 100µl of gDNA solution
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1µl of RNase A 100 mg/ml for 100µl of gDNA solution

components.data: Check the DNA integrity by running the sample on PFGE or capillary electrophoresis. The sample should range from 10-20kb to 100-150kb.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check the DNA integrity by running the sample on PFGE or capillary electrophoresis. The sample should range from 10-20kb to 100-150kb.
Mix by inverting the tube 10 times
Incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature (18-23°C)

components.data: Add 1 volume of beads solution prepared (make sure beads are at room temperature for >30 minutes and well homogenized via vortexing for approximately 30 seconds)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 volume of beads solution prepared (make sure beads are at room temperature for >30 minutes and well homogenized via vortexing for approximately 30 seconds)
• Follow the steps 16 to 34.

components.data: Check the DNA purity and integrity as in the steps 35-36.
